privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro:
This Privacy Policy describes how BookBed ("we," "us," or "our") collects, uses, and discloses your information when you use our mobile application (the "App") and our services.

By using the App, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this Privacy Policy.

section1.title: 1. Information We Collect
section1.content: We collect information to provide and improve our App, process bookings, and ensure the security of our services.

A.title: A. Personal Data
A.content: While using our App, we may ask you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information that can be used to contact or identify you, including but not limited to:
list: Identity Data: Name, surname.
Contact Data: Email address, phone number.
Account Data: Username, password (encrypted), and profile information.
Transaction Data: Details about bookings and payments (note: we do not store full credit card details; these are handled by our secure payment providers).

B.title: B. Usage Data
B.content: We may automatically collect information about how the App is accessed and used ("Usage Data"). This Usage Data may include:
list: Your device's Internet Protocol address (IP address).
Device type, version, and operating system.
Time and date of your visit, time spent on pages, and unique device identifiers.
Crash logs and diagnostic data.

C.title: C. Location Data
C.content: If you grant us permission, we may use your location data to help you find properties or services near you. You can enable or disable location services when you use our App at any time through your device settings.

D.title: D. File and Media Access
D.content: The App may require access to your device's camera or photo library (e.g., using image_picker) to allow you to upload profile photos or receipts. We only access this data when you explicitly grant permission and initiate the action.

section2.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
section2.content: We use the collected data for various purposes:
list: To provide and maintain our Service: Managing your bookings and account.
To notify you about changes: Service updates or booking confirmations.
To provide customer support: Responding to your inquiries.
To monitor usage: Analyzing how our App is used to improve features.
To detect and prevent technical issues: Ensuring the App is secure and bug-free.
To process payments: Facilitating transactions securely via third-party providers.

section3.title: 3. Data Retention
section3.content: We will retain your Personal Data only for as long as is necessary for the purposes set out in this Privacy Policy. We will retain and use your Personal Data to the extent necessary to comply with our legal obligations (for example, if we are required to retain your data to comply with applicable laws), resolve disputes, and enforce our legal agreements and policies.

section4.title: 4. Account Deletion (Right to be Forgotten)
section4.content: In compliance with App Store and Play Store guidelines: You have the right to request that we delete your account and associated data.
section4.subcontent: You can request account deletion by:
list: Navigating to the Profile or Settings section within the App and selecting "Delete Account".
Contacting us directly at info@bookbed.io.
section4.footer: Upon request, we will delete your personal information from our active databases, subject to any legal obligations we may have to retain certain data (e.g., for tax or accounting purposes regarding completed transactions).

section5.title: 5. Service Providers and Third-Party Services
section5.content:
We may employ third-party companies and individuals to facilitate our Service ("Service Providers"), to provide the Service on our behalf, or to assist us in analyzing how our Service is used.

These third parties have access to your Personal Data only to perform these tasks on our behalf and are obligated not to disclose or use it for any other purpose.

We use the following third-party services in our App:
list: Google Firebase: We use Firebase for authentication, database services (Firestore), and cloud functions.
Google Analytics for Firebase: To analyze app usage and user engagement.
Firebase Crashlytics: To collect crash data and help us improve app stability.
Sentry: For real-time error tracking and performance monitoring.
Stripe: For secure payment processing.

section6.title: 6. Security of Data
section6.content: The security of your data is important to us, but remember that no method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

section7.title: 7. Children's Privacy
section7.content: Our Service does not address anyone under the age of 13 (or applicable age in your jurisdiction). We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from anyone under the age of 13. If you are a parent or guardian and you are aware that your child has provided us with Personal Data, please contact us.

section8.title: 8. Changes to This Privacy Policy
section8.content:
We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the "Last updated" date using the most current date.

You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes.

section9.title: 9. Contact Us
section9.content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us:
list: By email: info@bookbed.io
By visiting this page on our website: https://bookbed.io

quickStart.title: Quick Start Guide
quickStart.intro: Get your BookBed account up and running in just 5 minutes. This guide will walk you through the essential setup steps.
quickStart.tip: You can always come back and add more details later. Start with the basics and expand as you go.

step1.title: Step 1: Create Your Account
items: Go to app.bookbed.io
Click "Sign Up" and enter your email address
Verify your email and set a secure password

step2.title: Step 2: Create Your First Property
step2.content: After logging in, you'll be prompted to create your first property. Enter:
items: Property name (e.g., "Villa Sunset")
Address (for your reference, not shown to guests publicly)
Default check-in and check-out times

step3.title: Step 3: Add a Unit
step3.content: Each property needs at least one unit (apartment, room, or villa). The setup wizard will guide you through adding:
step3.subcontent: Unit details like capacity, amenities, and photos. You can add multiple units to the same property.

step4.title: Step 4: Set Your Prices
step4.content: Configure your pricing in the Pricing tab. You can set a base price and add seasonal rules for different periods.

step5.title: Step 5: Publish and Embed
step5.content: Once your unit is ready, publish it and copy the embed code from the Widget Settings tab. Paste this code on your website to display the booking calendar.

quickStart.successText: You've completed the basic setup. Your property is now ready to receive bookings. Explore the other sections to learn about advanced features like Stripe payments and iCal synchronization.

createProperty.title: Creating a Property
createProperty.intro: A property in BookBed represents a physical location where you offer accommodation. Learn how to set one up correctly.

whatIsProperty.title: What is a Property?
whatIsProperty.content: A property is the top-level container in BookBed. It represents a single location that can contain one or more units (rentable spaces). Examples:

step1.title: Navigate to Properties
step1.content: From your dashboard, click on "Properties" in the sidebar, then click "Add Property" or the + button.

name.label: Property Name
name.desc: A memorable name for your property (e.g., "Beach House Croatia")

address.label: Address
address.desc: The full address. This is for your reference and can be shared with guests after booking.

description.label: Description
description.desc: Optional. A general description of your property.

checkInOut.label: Check-in/Check-out Times
checkInOut.desc: Default times for guest arrivals and departures.

step3.title: Save Your Property
step3.content: Click "Save" to create your property. You can now add units to it.

createProperty.tipContent: You can have multiple properties if you manage vacation rentals in different locations. Each property can have its own settings and units.

afterCreation.title: After Creating Your Property
afterCreation.content: Once your property is created, the next steps are:
steps: Add one or more units (apartments, rooms, villas)
Set up pricing for each unit
Configure availability rules

widgetEmbed.title: Embedding the Booking Widget
widgetEmbed.intro: The BookBed widget allows guests to view availability and make bookings directly from your website. Here's how to embed it.

getCode.title: Getting Your Embed Code
getCode.content: Follow these steps to get your widget embed code:
steps: Go to Unit Hub and select your unit
Click on the "Widget" tab
Make sure the unit is published
Click "Get Embed Code" to copy the iframe code

example.title: Example Embed Code
example.content: Your embed code will look similar to this:
example.note: Replace PROPERTY_ID and UNIT_ID with your actual IDs from the BookBed dashboard.

wordpress.title: WordPress
steps: Edit the page where you want the widget
Add a "Custom HTML" block
Paste the embed code and save

wix.title: Wix
steps: Open the Wix Editor
Add an "Embed HTML" element
Paste the iframe code and apply

squarespace.title: Squarespace
steps: Edit your page and add a "Code" block
Paste the embed code
Save and publish

html.title: Custom HTML Website
html.content: Simply paste the embed code anywhere in your HTML where you want the widget to appear.

widgetEmbed.warningContent: The widget requires JavaScript to function. Some website builders may block external iframes. If you encounter issues, contact your website platform's support.

issues.solution: Check that your unit is published and the IDs in the embed code are correct.
Adjust the min-height in the iframe style, or remove max-height restrictions.
Ensure you have connected Stripe or enabled bank transfer payments in Widget Settings.

stripe.title: Stripe Payment Integration
stripe.intro: Accept credit card payments from your guests with Stripe. It's secure, fast, and payments go directly to your bank account.
stripe.securityContent: Stripe is PCI-DSS Level 1 certified. BookBed never stores credit card numbers - all payment processing is handled by Stripe's secure servers.

whatIsStripe.title: What is Stripe?
whatIsStripe.content: Stripe is a global payment processor used by millions of businesses. With Stripe Connect, you can accept payments directly to your own Stripe account.
benefits: Accept all major credit cards (Visa, Mastercard, American Express)
Funds deposited directly to your bank account

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.content: When a guest makes a booking through your widget:
steps: Guest selects dates and enters their details
Guest is redirected to Stripe's secure checkout page
Guest enters payment details and confirms
Booking is automatically confirmed and you receive an email notification

connect.title: Connecting Your Stripe Account
connect.content: Follow these steps to connect Stripe:

step1.title: Navigate to Integrations
step1.content: Go to Settings > Integrations > Stripe and click "Connect Stripe Account".

step2.title: Complete Stripe Onboarding
step2.content: You'll be redirected to Stripe to either log in or create a new account. Stripe will ask for:

step3.title: Return to BookBed
step3.content: After completing Stripe onboarding, you'll be redirected back to BookBed. Your account status will show as "Connected".

stripe.successContent: Once connected, Stripe payments are automatically enabled for all your units. Guests can now pay with credit cards through your booking widget.

fees.title: Stripe Fees
fees.content: Stripe charges processing fees for each transaction:
items: European cards: 1.4% + €0.25 per transaction
Non-European cards: 2.9% + €0.25 per transaction

stripe.noteContent: Stripe fees are deducted from the payment before it reaches your bank account. BookBed does not charge any additional payment processing fees.

payouts.title: Receiving Payouts
payouts.content: Stripe typically sends payouts to your bank account within 2-7 business days, depending on your country. You can view all transactions in your Stripe Dashboard.

ical.title: iCal Synchronization
ical.intro: Sync your BookBed calendar with Airbnb, Booking.com, and other platforms to prevent double bookings.

whatIsIcal.title: What is iCal?
whatIsIcal.content: iCal is a standard calendar format that allows different booking platforms to share availability information. When a booking is made on one platform, it automatically blocks those dates on all connected platforms.

supported.title: Supported Platforms
supported.other: Any platform that supports iCal format

import.title: Importing Calendars (Other Platforms → BookBed)
import.content: To import bookings from other platforms into BookBed:

airbnb.title: From Airbnb
steps: Log in to Airbnb and go to your listing
Click "Availability" then "Calendar Sync"
Copy the "Export Calendar" URL
In BookBed, go to Integrations > iCal
Click "Add Calendar" and paste the URL

booking.title: From Booking.com
steps: Log in to Booking.com Extranet
Go to "Property" > "iCal Sync"
Copy the "Export Calendar" URL
In BookBed, go to Integrations > iCal
Click "Add Calendar" and paste the URL

syncFrequency.title: Sync Frequency
syncFrequency.content: BookBed automatically syncs imported calendars every 15 minutes. You can also trigger a manual sync at any time from the iCal settings page.

export.title: Exporting Your BookBed Calendar
export.content: To sync BookBed bookings to other platforms:
steps: Go to Integrations > iCal in BookBed
Copy your unit's "Export URL"
Paste this URL in the "Import Calendar" section of Airbnb, Booking.com, or other platforms

twoWay.title: Two-Way Sync
twoWay.content: For complete synchronization, you need to set up BOTH import (other → BookBed) AND export (BookBed → other) for each platform. This ensures all calendars stay perfectly synchronized.

ical.warningContent: iCal sync has a delay of up to 15-30 minutes. For last-minute bookings, there's a small risk of double booking. Always check your calendar before accepting same-day or next-day reservations.

issues.solution: Check that the URL is correct and the source calendar is accessible.
Wait up to 15 minutes for the sync to complete, or trigger a manual sync.
Make sure you haven't imported the same calendar twice.

units.title: Adding Units
units.intro: Units are the individual spaces guests can book within your property. Learn how to set them up.

sections.title: What is a Unit?
sections.content: A unit is a bookable space within your property - an apartment, room, or entire villa.
items: Each unit has its own calendar, pricing, and availability
Guests book specific units, not the entire property
You can have multiple units per property

sections.title: Creating a Unit
items: Go to your property and click "Add Unit"
Enter unit name, capacity, and description
Add photos and amenities
Set the base price and availability rules

sections.title: Unit Details
sections.content: Make your unit stand out with complete information:
items: High-quality photos (at least 5 recommended)
Detailed description highlighting unique features
Complete amenities list (WiFi, parking, kitchen, etc.)
Accurate capacity and bed configuration

pricing.title: Setting Prices
pricing.intro: Configure your pricing strategy with base rates, seasonal pricing, and special offers.

sections.title: Base Price
sections.content: The base price is your default nightly rate:
items: Set a competitive base price for your unit
This rate applies when no seasonal rules are active
You can update it anytime from the Pricing tab

sections.title: Seasonal Pricing
items: Create pricing rules for high season, low season, holidays
Set date ranges and percentage adjustments
Rules automatically apply to the calendar

sections.title: Minimum Stay
items: Global minimum stay for the unit
Override for specific date ranges
Useful for peak seasons or weekend minimums

availability.title: Managing Availability
availability.intro: Control when your units are available for booking.

sections.title: Blocking Dates
items: Click on dates in the calendar to block them
Use for maintenance, personal use, or pre-existing bookings
Blocked dates appear as unavailable to guests

sections.title: Advance Booking Window
sections.content: Control how far in advance guests can book:
items: Minimum advance: Prevent same-day or last-minute bookings
Maximum advance: Limit how far into the future guests can book
Adjust based on your flexibility and planning needs

manageBookings.title: Managing Bookings
manageBookings.intro: Learn how to handle incoming reservations, communicate with guests, and manage your booking pipeline.

sections.title: Booking List
sections.content: View all your bookings in one place:
items: Filter by status (pending, confirmed, completed, cancelled)
Sort by check-in date, guest name, or booking date
Click any booking to view full details

sections.title: Handling Pending Bookings
items: Review booking details and guest information
Confirm to accept the booking, or decline if unavailable
Guest receives an automatic email notification

sections.title: Cancellations
items: You can cancel a booking from the booking details page
Cancelled bookings free up the dates automatically
Guest is notified via email about the cancellation

calendar.title: Using the Calendar
calendar.intro: The timeline calendar gives you a visual overview of all bookings across your units.

sections.title: Calendar Views
items: Timeline view shows all units in a single view
Switch between day, week, and month views
Click on bookings to see details

sections.title: Color Coding
sections.content: Understand booking status at a glance:
items: Green: Confirmed bookings
Yellow: Pending (awaiting confirmation)
Blue: Checked-in guests
Gray: Completed stays

statuses.title: Booking Statuses
statuses.intro: Understanding the different booking statuses and what they mean.

sections.title: Status Types
sections.content: Each booking goes through these stages:
items: Pending: New booking awaiting your confirmation or payment
Confirmed: Booking is accepted and payment received
Checked In: Guest has arrived
Completed: Guest has checked out
Cancelled: Booking was cancelled by you or the guest

sections.title: Automatic Status Updates
items: After check-out date, status changes to Completed
Payment expiration converts Pending to Cancelled
Successful payment moves Pending to Confirmed

widgetSetup.title: Widget Setup
widgetSetup.intro: Configure your booking widget before embedding it on your website.

sections.title: Publishing Your Unit
sections.content: Before embedding, your unit must be published:
items: Go to Unit Hub and select your unit
Check that all required fields are filled
Click "Publish" to make the unit available

sections.title: Widget Modes
items: Full Booking: Guests can complete bookings with payment
Calendar Only: Show availability without booking functionality
Inquiry Mode: Guests can request bookings without immediate payment

sections.title: Payment Options

Pay on Arrival: No upfront payment required

widgetCustomize.title: Customizing the Widget
widgetCustomize.intro: Make the widget match your website's look and feel.

sections.title: Theme
items: Light theme for bright websites
Dark theme for dark-themed websites
Auto: Follows user's system preference

sections.title: Language
items: Auto-detect from browser settings

notifications.title: Email Notifications
notifications.intro: Configure which email notifications you receive.

sections.title: Booking Notifications

Cancellation alerts

sections.title: Guest Communications

subdomain.title: Custom Subdomain

sections.title: What is a Subdomain?
sections.content: A subdomain gives you a clean, branded URL:
items: Example: your-name.view.bookbed.io
Share directly with guests or embed on your site
Looks professional and trustworthy

sections.title: Setting Up Your Subdomain

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.intro: Find answers to common questions about BookBed.

sections.title: Getting Started
items: Q: Is BookBed free? A: Contact us for pricing information tailored to your needs.
Q: How long does setup take? A: Most users are up and running within 15-30 minutes.
Q: Do I need technical skills? A: No, BookBed is designed for non-technical users.

sections.title: Payments
items: Q: When do I receive my money? A: Stripe payouts arrive in 2-7 business days.
Q: What payment methods are supported? A: Credit cards via Stripe, bank transfers, and cash on arrival.
Q: Are there any hidden fees? A: BookBed is transparent. Stripe charges their standard processing fees.

sections.title: Technical
items: Q: Can I use BookBed on mobile? A: Yes, the owner dashboard works on all devices.
Q: Does the widget work on all websites? A: It works on most platforms that support iframe embedding.
Q: Is my data secure? A: Yes, we use industry-standard encryption and security practices.
